insights: Tokyo is 25% more expensive than Osaka
Accommodation costs are highest in Tokyo
Kyoto falls between Tokyo and Osaka for overall costs
Street food is most affordable in Osaka
categories.reasoning: Osaka offers the best value for money with lower accommodation and dining costs

insights: Kyoto has the most attractions with 180 sites
Tokyo offers the most diverse modern attractions
Kyoto has 17 UNESCO World Heritage Sites
Osaka focuses on entertainment and food experiences
categories.reasoning: Kyoto has the highest concentration of cultural and historical attractions

insights: Tokyo has the most Michelin stars globally
Osaka is known as 'Japan's Kitchen'
Kyoto offers traditional kaiseki cuisine
Street food is best in Osaka
categories.reasoning: Tokyo has the most diverse and internationally acclaimed dining scene

insights: Tokyo has the most extensive train network
All cities have excellent punctuality
Kyoto is more walkable and bike-friendly
Tokyo can be overwhelming for first-time visitors
categories.reasoning: Tokyo has the most comprehensive and efficient transportation system

insights: Kyoto is Japan's cultural capital
Tokyo blends modern and traditional elements
Osaka has authentic local culture
Kyoto offers the most traditional experiences
categories.reasoning: Kyoto preserves Japan's most authentic traditional culture and heritage

insights: Tokyo has the most diverse nightlife options
Osaka offers friendly, local nightlife experiences
Kyoto focuses on traditional evening experiences
Tokyo nightlife operates latest into the night
categories.reasoning: Tokyo offers the most vibrant and diverse nightlife scene in Japan

methodology: Data collected from official tourism boards, hotel booking sites, and local research
